As one of Britain's foremost higher education institutions for the study and advancement of fine art, design and architecture, the importance of the GSA in the cultural, social and economic life of Scotland and beyond, cannot be underestimated. And, in a rapidly changing world where creativity is increasingly seen at the heart of a wider competitive economy, it is clear that The Glasgow School of Art will continue to play a major role in the future.

To ensure we can continue to play a major role now and in the future, the GSA has ambitious plans. Ranging from the redevelopment of our campus with a refurbished Mackintosh Building at its heart to the creation of new research centres and the provision of scholarships and bursaries, private support is the key to making this possible.

Across the world alumni and friends of The Glasgow School of Art are playing their part in helping us realise our plans by donating to the Creative Futures Fund and becoming International Friends of the GSA.

Trusts, foundations and companies are also playing their part and their gifts and sponsorship is making an impact through projects such as the Clydesdale Bank Art for All workshops for over 70 secondary schools across the West of Scotland or the creation of scholarships within the International Drawing Research Institute by the Horace W. Goldsmith Foundation in New York.

Whether you are an alumnus, visitor or friend, or a trust, foundation or company, you can help the GSA to achieve its goals and we invite you to explore this site and consider how you would like to become involved.

If you would like more information or to speak in person to someone about how you can support the GSA, please contact Scott Parsons, Head of Marketing and Development (+44(0) 141 353 4698 s.parsons@gsa.ac.uk)

column4: • GSA alumni include Turner Prize Winners Douglas Gordon and Simon Starling
• Three GSA alumni have won the Beck's Futures - the UK's leading art prize for young artists - Roddy Buchanan, Toby Paterson and Rosalind Nashashibi
• Each year GSA alumni, friends, trusts, foundations and companies donate over quarter of a million pounds towards scholarships and enriching the student experience
• GSA alumni can be found worldwide including USA, Canada, China, Japan, Singapore and across Europe
• In 2005 1/3 of the new designers recruited by Dyson were GSA graduates
• Robbie Coltrane, Murial Grey, Peter Capaldi and Carol Smillie are all alumni of the GSA
• The American Friends of the Glasgow School of Art is based in New York - just part of the GSA's international network
• All of the artists selected to represent Scotland at the Venice Biennale 2005 were graduates of the GSA
• In 2005 two of the four artists nominated for the Turner Prize were GSA graduates - Simon Starling and Jim Lambie
• GSA has produced brands such as Franz Ferdinand, Travis and El Presidente - reinforcing Glasgow's position as Europe's rock music capital
